text:
AP_LONG in include/ap_sha1.h assumes a 32-bit long. This breaks SHA-1 on 64-bit
platforms.

Similarly, UINT4 in ap_md5.h assumes a 32-bit int, which could lead to similar
problems (not verified, however).
creator: william@25thandClement.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
These are fixed in 2.0, changing any of these types in 1.3 would constitute a
binary compatibility break so is a probably unlikely...
